content.description: Obvious weakness that goes from the bottom almost to the top.  Moderate climbing to an interesting finish.  Starts in a wide crack and follows weakness through bulges.
Great jug pulling on overhanging rock for the first half, then good face climbing with some hidden holds.
content.protection: Bolted with chains at the top
content.location: Bolted line up the steepest overhanging feature

content.description: Sustained climbing most of the way.  This route is listed as route 10 in the Squeezing the Lemmon II but it is really #11.
content.location: Just left of SPF-12 which is where the wall really gets steep.

content.description: 10 feet of right angling crack leads to good hold and first bolt.  If you figure out the sequence it is in the grade but that is not easy to do.  If you do what most of us have done you will power through a harder move or fall on an good piece of gear.
content.protection: Small cams or nuts to red camalot.  You will only need a few at most.  Bolts the rest of the way.
content.location: 10 feet of right angling crack leads to the first bolt.  Lower off.

content.description: Right angling route that finishes by joining the top of another route.
content.protection: Bolts with a long run between the 2nd and 3rd bolt.  A 3 Camalot can be used to protect it but the climbing is easy and the clip is not hard to get once you get there.
content.location: Starts just below the rock that forms a flat spot at the bottom of Leisure Time and Belly Up To The Knee Bar.

content.description: Club Med is shorter than Weathertop and the easiest route there is 5.10 and steep.  The bolted routes are more old school sport and so you will actually have to get your feet above bolt before you clip the next one even if you are 6 feet tall.
